NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. cover or roll up 包，裹
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The shop assistant wrapped up the dress for her.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vt. 使陷于困境;使坠入陷阱  n. 陷阱
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The police trapped the thieves.
e.g. He concealed the sweets in his pocket.
e.g. The pressures of modern life are great.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi. jump or fall suddenly and with force 纵身跳进
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He plunged into the water to save the child.
e.g. Don't crush this box; it has flowers in it.
e.g. A branch snapped off the tree in the wind.
e.g. Don't squeeze the kitten; you will hurt it.

NewWords.WordPhrase: vi.  晕倒;坍塌;垮下  vt. 毁坏
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. The old man collapsed in the street.
e.g. He shivered as he heard the strange noise in the night.

NewWords.WordPhrase: be the duty or responsibility of 是...的职责
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. It'up to us to give them all the help we can.

NewWords.WordPhrase: n. no place 不存在的地方，不知名的地方
NewWords.Sentence: e.g. He is nowhere to be seen.
e.g. She was so quiet that her presence was hardly noticed.
e.g. It's hard work, but if you hang on long enough you'll succeed.
